title: Print, "Engraving:  Versailles, Grotto, Interior.", 1676
inscribed:
Engraved on the plate at lower right:  "Le Potre Sculps. 1676"
Inscription at lower left:  "Veue du fonds de la Grotte le soleil au milieu des nymphes de Thetis; et ses chevaux pensez par des Tritons"
Lower right:  "Prospectus cyptae Interioris Versaliarum, ubi sol inter nympas Thetidis, et etus equi cum Tritonibus, statuis marmoreis exhibentur."
Numbered at lower right:  "7"
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Horizontal rectangle:  The whole is decorated with inlaid shells and the floor is of inlaid pebbles.  There are three niches, each with a group of white marble statuary:  the middle group of Apollo and nymphs and the other two of horses and tritons.
